definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: This is electron volts per atom.
sentences.chinese: 这是每个原子所具有的电子伏特。

sentences.english: Forcomparison, the energy of visible light is between 2 and 3 electron volts.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，可见光的能量在2至3电子伏特之间。

sentences.english: It is up around 13, 14, 15 electron volts.
sentences.chinese: 它最高大约为13，14，15电子伏特。
就是一单位的电子伏特。

definition: electron volt (unit of energy used in particle physics, approximately 10^-19 Joules)
mega electron volt MeV (unit of energy equal to 1.6 x 10-13 Joules)
neutrino (particle physics)/also written 微中子[wei1 zhong1 zi3]
nanosecond, ns, 10^-9 s (PRC)/Taiwan equivalent: 奈秒[nai4 miao3]
Planck's constant h, approximately equal to 6.626 x 10^-34 joule.seconds or 4.135 x 10^-15 electron volt.seconds
